The incr CommandÂ¶

incr, increment a parameter value:

incr [ -a ] name

Increment an integer parameter value. The parameter must already exist and it’s value is incremented by one. This operation breaks the scoping models as the value is updated in the first scope the defines the parameter. If this is deeper than the current scope, the incremented value is retained after the current scope ends. If the -a option is given all instances of the parameter in all scopes is incremented (this is the mechanism used to increment the number of OK and failure tests).

Examples:

ZBTest> set -i num 0
ZBTest> incr num
Incremented the parmeter "num" to 1
ZBTest> begin
ZBTest> incr num
Incremented the parmeter "num" to 2
ZBTest> print num
2
ZBTest> end
ZBTest> print num
2
